France and Colombia remain at an impasse on whether to eradicate or legalize cocaine
subhed: During a visit to Colombia, French foreign affairs minister Jean-Noël Barrot unveiled a 'battle plan' to fight organized crime. Colombian President Gustavo Petro has called on the international community to consider legalizing cocaine as a way to weaken drug traffickers.

title: When a Syrian author becomes the voice of Gaza's survivors
subhed: 'A Memory of Annihilation,' the latest book by Samar Yazbek, brings together a striking series of testimonies from survivors of the hell in Gaza.

title: 'The Voice of Hind Rajab': The final moments of a Palestinian girl killed by Israeli fire
subhed: Kaouther Ben Hania's film features the audio recording of the child, made on January 29, 2024, as she called Palestinian Red Crescent rescuers.

title: Four reasons French winegrowers are angry
subhed: Wine production in 2025 is expected to match that of 2024, which was already a disastrous year. Le Monde examines the four main factors behind this downturn.

title: Forgotten Louvre security report highlighted specific balcony used by crown jewel thieves
subhed: Le Monde has learned that a 2018 security audit explicitly identified the balcony used by the thieves as a point of vulnerability, even noting the possibility that a freight lift could be used to access it.

title: Boualem Sansal: 'At my age, I am not about to learn to hold my tongue...'
subhed: The French-Algerian writer, who has been in France since November 18, has regained his freedom, including his freedom of speech. He recounts his yearlong detention in Algeria, discusses the remarks that led to his arrest, and reflects on the future of relations between France and Algeria.

title: Niklas Frank, a son consumed by hatred for his Nazi father
subhed: Niklas Frank, an 86-year-old former journalist, is known in Germany for his absolute loathing of his father. As a Reich official, Hans Frank, appointed by Hitler in Poland, was among those sentenced to death at the Nuremberg trials, which began 80 years ago.
